headline: Where Will FuboTV Stock Be in 3 Years?
summary: Up until 2025, FuboTV (NYSE: FUBO) was something of an also-ran in the streaming wars.  It was attempting to build an independent streaming service even as content giants like Walt Disney (NYSE: DIS) were building their own services.  FuboTV has posted a lot of red ink and has less than 1.7 million customers to show for it.

headline: Now Streaming: Analysts boost Netflix targets after Q1 beat
summary: “Now Streaming” is The Fly’s weekly recap of the stories surrounding the biggest content streamers. PLAYING THIS WEEKEND: Among this weekend’s highly-anticipated new streaming content is the first few episodes of “Andor,” a drama series set in the “Star Wars” universe, on Disney+ (DIS). Meanwhile, Netflix (NFLX) subscribers can catch the fifth season of drama series “You,” as well as neo-noir action thriller film “Havoc,” starring Tom Hardy and Forest Whitaker. headline: Warner Bros. Discovery: More Difficulties Ahead But Buy Rating Seems Justified
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery stock has fallen sharply in recent months and a buy rating is now justified. Read why WBD is a good bet, apart from the low valuation.
